main event: On 27 Apr 61, the crew of a Far East American Airlines aircraft observed an unidentified object while flying from Okinawa to Yokota AB, Japan.
interesting points: The object was first seen approximately 1000 miles east of Yokota AB at an altitude of about 35,000 feet., It was round, silver, and approximately 40-50 feet in diameter., The object had a steady, brilliant white light and was observed for 20-25 minutes., As the aircraft approached within 15 miles, the object accelerated and climbed rapidly, disappearing within 10 seconds., The reporting pilot confirmed it was not a known type of aircraft.
sighted object: unidentified round silver object with a brilliant white light
witness description: crew of a Far East American Airlines aircraft
